en: Originally in 1886 Coca Cola was introduced as an 'intellectual beverage' to boost brain power.
A Boeing 747 airliner holds 216,847 litres (57,285 gallons) of fuel.
The first product to have a bar code was Wrigley's gum.
Joseph Biedenharn invented pouring Coca-Cola into the bottles after 8 years of drink's invention.
Apple's iPhone consumes US$0.25 worth of electricity per year if it's fully charged once a day.\n
Pez was invented in 1927.
In the first quarter of 2014, Apple earned more than Google, Facebook, and Amazon combined.
Porsche also builds tractors.
A rare Apple-1 computer built in Steve Jobs' garage in the summer of 1976 was sold at an auction in 2014 for US$905,000.
Everything you say to Siri is sent to Apple, analyzed and stored.
Nintendo first produced playing cards.
Apple has more operating cash than the U.S. Treasury.
60% of apps in the Apple App Store have never been downloaded.
Apple's co-founder sold all his shares for $800. Today, they would have been worth US$35 billion.
The last Play Boy centerfold to have staples was published in 1985.
The battery of an Apple Macbook could save you from a gunshot: it's bulletproof.
The first paperback book was printed by Penguin Publishing in 1935.
Franklin Mars invented the Snickers Bar in 1930.
The Australian aircraft carrier QANTAS stands for Queensland And Northern Territories Aerial Service.
Apple's brand is worth US$118.9 billion. It is the world's most valuable brand.
Apple earns US$300,000 per minute.
The dollar values on the board game Monopoly have been the same since 1935.
The Colgate toothpaste company started out making starch, soap, and candles.
Samsung makes about 30% of the A8 chips that go into Apple's iPhone 6.
MasterCard was originally called MasterCharge.
The first Burger King was opened in Florida Miami in 1954.
Apple is the world's second-largest by the mobile phone manufacturer.
Coca Cola launched its 3rd product Sprite in 1961.
Bayer, famous for producing aspirin, bought prisoners from Auschwitz to use as research subjects for testing new drugs.
The World's most valuable brands are Apple, Microsoft, and Google.
Apple is the world's largest IT company by revenue and total assets.
Diet Coke was introduced in 1982.
Smoking near Apple computers voids the warranty.
Apple's iPhone is almost twice more expensive in Brazil than in the U.S.
Apple has 45 retail stores in 17 countries, as of 2016.\n
Apple headquarters' employees earn an average of US$125,000 a year.
Google hired a camel to create the Street View of a desert
Siri was supposed to be for Android and BlackBerry phones before Siri Inc. was bought by Apple back in April of 2010.
Apple's iPhone has higher sales than everything Microsoft has to offer.
The first credit card was a Diner's Club card issued in 1950.
You have a better chance of getting accepted to Harvard University than getting a job at the Apple Store.
There are 22 stars in the Paramount studios logo.
Apple sold 340,000 iPhones per day in 2012.
According to manufacturer Spalding the average lifespan of an NBA basketball is 10,000 bounces.
Hilton was the first international hotel chain.
Apple Is Worth More Than The Entire Russian Stock Market.
Apple iPad's retina display is actually manufactured by Samsung.
If you use iTunes, you have already agreed not to use Apple products to create nuclear weapons.
If you would have bought an iPhone in 1991, part by part, it would have cost you US$3.56 million.
Apple has over 115,000 employees around the world.
The creator of the iPod first offered the idea to Philips and RealNetworks, but they failed to see its potential.
The first Lifesaver flavor was peppermint.
Originally, BMW was an airplane engine manufacturer.
Coca-Cola was originally green.
Dell Computers was started by a 19 year old with only $1,000.
Warner Communications paid $28 million for the copyright to the song "Happy Birthday".
The founder of Victoria's Secret was a man named Roy Raymond.
Bill Gates, the founder of Microsoft was a college drop out.
Forty percent of McDonald's profits comes from the sale of Happy Meals.
McDonald's sells more than 75 burgers per second.
Facebook pays at least $500 if you can find a way to hack the site.
The founder of JC Penny had the name of James Cash Penny.
The Pringles Company located in Jackson, TN produced the world's largest potato chip in 1990. The measurements were 23" x 14.5".
Colgate faced big obstacle marketing toothpaste in Spanish speaking countries because Colgate translates into the command 'go hang yourself.'
The first product of the Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing Company (now known as 3M) was sandpaper.
The red spot on the 7up cans comes from it's inventor. He was an albino (albinos have red eyes).
The first portable calculator placed on sale by Texas Instruments weighed only 2-1/2 pounds and cost a mere $150. (1971).
Success magazine recently declared bankruptcy.
Did you know the brand Nokia is named after a place in Southern Finland?
